alert.note: Alert for Clay; Clinton; Platte (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:13PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Clinton, northern Clay and northeastern Platte Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 313 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Trimble, or near Smithville, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Smithville, Kearney, Platte City, Plattsburg, Trimble, Edgerton, Camden Point, Ferrelview, Tracy, Mosby, Ridgely and Hoover. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 22 and 29. Interstate 29 between mile markers 13 and 26. Interstate 435 between mile markers 28 and 38, and between mile markers 40 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Missouri.
